name: Clin T Floor of Mouth
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:** Periosteum is a fibrous membrane that wraps the outer surface of bones. Cortical bone is the dense compact outer layer of the bone. Trabecular, cancellous, or spongy bone (spongiosa) is a porous network of tissue filling the interior of bone, decreasing weight and allowing room for blood vessels and marrow.

**Note 2:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1, T2 or T3. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1, T2 or T3 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 3:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2 or T3) based on the tumor size when involvement is limited to the cortical bone. Involvement through cortical bone is required for assignment of T4a. 

    Invasive tumor on one side confined to:
        Lamina propria
        Submucosa
        Tumor crosses midline

    Anterior 2/3 of tongue
    Base of tongue
    Bone, NOS
    Cartilage, NOS
    Cortical bone of mandible
    Cortical bone of maxilla
    Cortical bone, NOS
    Epiglottis
    Gingiva (alveolar ridge), lower
    Glossoepiglottic fold
    Glossopharyngeal sulcus
    Lateral pharyngeal wall
    Mandible, NOS
    Maxilla, NOS
    Periosteum of mandible
    Pharyngeal (lingual) surface
    Pharyngoepiglottic fold
    Subcutaneous soft tissue of chin/neck
    Sublingual gland, including ducts
    Submandibular (submaxillary) glands, including ducts
    Tonsillar pillars and fossae
    Tonsils
    Vallecula

    Confined to floor of mouth
    Localized, NOS
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary site
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

(lip) Tumor invades through: 
     Cortical bone 
     Floor of mouth
     Inferior alveolar nerve
     Skin (chin or nose)

(oral cavity) Tumor invades through: 
     Cortical bone 
     Into deep/extrinsic muscle of tongue: 
          Genioglossus
          Hyoglossus
          Palatoglossus
          Styloglossus 
     Maxillary sinus 
     Skin of face

    Genioglossus

    Hyoglossus

    Styloglossus

Maxillary sinus (antrum)
Skin of undersurface of chin/neck
Trabecular bone of mandible

    Masticator space 
    Pterygoid plates
    Skull base

or Encases internal carotid artery
